discussion.content: A and D

Seems to be correct

questions.question_text:
A customer’s cybersecurity department needs to implement security for the traffic between two VPCs in AWS, but these belong to different departments within the company. The company uses a single region for all their VPCs.
Which two actions will achieve this requirement while keeping separate management of each departments VPC? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Migrate all the instances to the same VPC and create IAM accounts for each department, then implement a new subnet for a FortiGate auto-scaling group and use routing tables to force the traffic through the FortiGate cluster.
choices.A: Create a transit VPC with a FortiGate HA cluster, connect to the other two using VPC peering, and use routing tables to force traffic through the FortiGate cluster.
choices.D: Create a VPC with a FortiGate auto-scaling group with a Transit Gateway attached to the three VPC to force routing through the FortiGate cluster.
choices.B: Create an IAM account for the cybersecurity department to manage both existing VPC, create a FortiGate HA Cluster on each VPC and IPSEC VPN to force traffic between the VPCs through the FortiGate clusters.

the last rightmost node logo is a file, meaning it is a ransomware attack, and the Block fortinet Logo is grey ( not red) meaning it is a simulated block...the attack was not stopped

exhibit also shows that the attack is using the Cobalt Strike beacon. Cobalt Strike is a penetration testing tool that can be used for both legitimate and malicious purposes. In this case, the Cobalt Strike beacon is being used to exfiltrate files from the device.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit.
The exhibit shows the forensics analysis of an event detected by the FortiEDR core.
In this scenario, which statement is correct regarding the threat?

choices.D: This is a ransomware attack and has been stopped by FortiEDR
choices.C: This is a ransomware attack and has not been stopped by FortiEDR
choices.B: This is an exfiltration attack and has not been stopped by FortiEDR
choices.A: This is an exfiltration attack and has been stopped by FortiEDR
It provides support for multiple DHCP servers within the same VLAN
choices.C: It provides support for IGMP snooping between hosts within the same VLAN
choices.D: It allows for assignment of dynamic address objects matching NAC policy
choices.B: It provides physical isolation without changing the IP address of hosts

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
https://docs.fortinet.com/document/fortigate/7.0.0/new-features/856212/nac-lan-segments-7-0-1

Selected Answer: B
This is stated in the document.
Both B and D are correct. But only one answer are selected. Confusion here

Selected Answer: B
https://docs.fortinet.com/document/fortigate/7.0.0/new-features/856212/nac-lan-segments-7-0-1

D is correct 

FortiGate NAC LAN Segments are a feature that allows users to assign different VLANs to different LAN segments without changing the IP address of hosts or bouncing the switch port. This provides physical isolation while maintaining firewall sessions and avoiding DHCP issues. One benefit of using FortiGate NAC LAN Segments is that it allows for assignment of dynamic address objects matching NAC policy.

questions.question_text: What is the benefit of using FortiGate NAC LAN Segments?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B correct
